landing.headline: Design, run, and explore social simulations driven by large language models.
landing.sub: Coordinate agents, branch timelines, and share live results with an interface built for experimentation teams.

exportModal.title: Export Data
exportModal.hintAllLogsCsv: CSV format flattens logs into a table, suitable for Excel analysis.
exportModal.hintAllLogsJson: JSON format retains complete nested structure, suitable for programmatic processing.
exportModal.hintAgentDataCsv: CSV format only includes basic agent information and flattened attributes.
exportModal.hintAgentDataJson: Includes complete agent memory, historical status curves, and all other data.

guidePrompt.systemPrompt:
You are the expert guide for "SocialSim4 Next", a social simulation platform.
     Your goal is to help users design experiments and navigate the platform features.
     
     PLATFORM CAPABILITIES MAP:
     1. **New Simulation**: 'SimulationWizard' (Create sim from templates like Village/Council/Werewolf, Import Agents, AI Generate Agents).
     2. **Social Network**: 'NetworkEditor' (Define topology like Ring/Star/Small World to control information flow).
     3. **Experiment Design**: 'ExperimentDesigner' (Causal inference, AB testing, parallel branches, control groups).
     4. **Host Control**: 'HostPanel' (God mode, broadcast messages, inject environment events, modify agent properties).
     5. **Analytics**: 'AnalyticsPanel' (Line charts for agent properties like Trust/Stress over time).
     6. **Export**: 'ExportModal' (Download logs as JSON/CSV/Excel).
     7. **Reports**: 'ReportModal' (AI-generated analysis reports).
     8. **SimTree**: The main visualization. Supports 'Branching' (create parallel timeline) and 'Advancing' (next round).
     9. **Comparison**: 'ComparisonView' (Diff two nodes/timelines).

     INSTRUCTIONS:
     - Analyze the user's intent.
     - Provide a concise, step-by-step guide mapping their goal to specific Platform Tools.
     - If the user needs to OPEN a specific tool, append a tag at the end of your response in the format: [[ACTION_NAME]].
     - Supported Tags: [[OPEN_WIZARD]], [[OPEN_NETWORK]], [[OPEN_EXPERIMENT]], [[OPEN_EXPORT]], [[OPEN_ANALYTICS]], [[OPEN_HOST]].
     - You can include multiple tags if relevant, but prioritize the most important one.
     - Use Markdown for formatting.
guidePrompt.defaultResponse: Sorry, I cannot understand your request.
guidePrompt.connectionTimeout: AI service connection timeout, please try again later.

experimentDesignModal.hintAutoParallel: System will automatically run all branches in parallel.

reportModal.title: Simulation Experiment Analysis Report
reportModal.subtitle: Automated Analysis
reportModal.singleRoundWarning: Only one node/round, cannot adjust range.

reportModal.generateDescription: The system will read the current experiment logs and agent history, using LLM to generate a complete report including summary, key events, behavior analysis, and improvement suggestions.

syncModal.title: Manual Sync to Backend
syncModal.warningMessage: This operation will overwrite and save the current simulation to the backend record with the same name. It will not automatically create a draft. Please confirm before proceeding.
syncModal.noLogsYet: No logs yet. Click the button below to start syncing.
syncModal.confirmSaveBackend: Confirm saving current simulation to backend? This will overwrite records with the same name.

templateSaveModal.title: Save as Template
templateSaveModal.info: Currently contains {{count}} agents. Current time configuration and scenario logic will be saved. Historical run logs will not be saved.
templateSaveModal.descriptionPlaceholder: Describe applicable scenarios or special configurations for this template...
templateSaveModal.imageHelper: Optional: Upload image and auto-insert as markdown link. Cropping not supported.

timeSettingsModal.title: Time Flow Settings
timeSettingsModal.description: Adjust the time span for simulation advancement. Changes will take effect in the next round and will not affect historical records.

errorBoundary.title: Frontend Runtime Error (Not a Backend Issue)
errorBoundary.instructions: Please copy or screenshot the red error message above, or the red line in the browser console (F12), and share it with the development team.

docsPage.title: Documentation / User Guide
docsPage.placeholderText: Currently, this deployment has not yet integrated the MDX documentation system with virtual:docs from the original project. This is a placeholder page to avoid build errors.
docsPage.youCanStillUse: You can still use the following features:
docsPage.featureSettings: API Provider / Search Provider settings in Settings
docsPage.futureRestore: If you want to restore the full documentation system in the future, we can:
docsPage.futureStep1: Add a Vite plugin in frontend to automatically collect docs/**/*.mdx files and generate virtual:docs module.
docsPage.currentGoal: Current version goal: Ensure the system can be fully built and run, without build interruptions from development-time virtual modules like virtual:docs.

agents.councilProfile: A council member responsible for urban planning and resource allocation decisions.
agents.aliceProfile: A pragmatic leader focused on village stability. Prioritizes consensus but can appear indecisive at times.
agents.bobProfile: An ambitious merchant who puts profit first. Often advocates for deregulation.

store.eventContextFit: Why this event fits the current context
store.guideWelcomeMessage:
Hello! I am SocialSim4's intelligent guide assistant. I can help you design experiments, recommend features, or explain platform operations. For example, you can ask me:

- "How to simulate information propagation in a crowd?"
- "I want to run an AB test experiment."
- "How to export analysis reports?"

helpModal.title: Understanding the Frontier Concept
helpModal.whatIsFrontierLeafDesc: Frontier leaves represent the latest endpoints in the simulation timeline. They are nodes that currently have no child nodes.
helpModal.batchAdvanceAllDesc: This command identifies all nodes with blue borders (leaf nodes) and advances them one turn simultaneously. This is useful for exploring multiple "what if" scenarios in parallel.
helpModal.onlyMaxDepthDesc: When checked, the system will only advance leaf nodes at the **deepest level** of the simulation tree. Shorter branches that have ended or been abandoned will be ignored.

step1.title: Choose interaction patterns for your experiment
step1.subtitle: Select one or more patterns that describe interactions you want to study

strategic_decisions.title: Strategic Decisions
strategic_decisions.description: Study situations where outcomes depend on what others choose

opinions_influence.title: Opinions & Influence
opinions_influence.description: Model how views shift through social interaction and influence

network_spread.description: Study how ideas, behaviors, or information spread through connections

markets_exchange.title: Markets & Exchange
markets_exchange.description: Model buying, selling, bidding, and trading

spatial_movement.title: Spatial & Movement
spatial_movement.description: Study scenarios where location and proximity matter

open_conversation.title: Open Conversation
open_conversation.description: Agents simply talk and discuss - no formal structure

step1.optionalAddonsDesc: Based on your selection, you can add voting, multiple phases, or scripted agents in later steps.

normDisruption.name: Norm Disruption
normDisruption.description: Ethnomethodology perspective: 20 heterogeneous agents construct meaning and adapt during sudden norm changes. Observe the evolution trajectory from compliance → resistance → black market protocols.

norm_disruption.name: Norm Disruption
norm_disruption.description: Ethnomethodology perspective: 20 heterogeneous agents construct meaning and adapt during sudden norm changes. Observe the evolution trajectory from compliance → resistance → black market protocols.

policyDiffusion.name: Policy Diffusion and Meaning Erosion
policyDiffusion.description: Street bureaucracy perspective: Simulate policy reconstruction and alienation in a three-tier organization (government → community → residents). Verify how underlying logic undermines macro planning.

policy_diffusion.name: Policy Diffusion and Meaning Erosion
policy_diffusion.description: Street bureaucracy perspective: Simulate policy reconstruction and alienation in a three-tier organization (government → community → residents). Verify how underlying logic undermines macro planning.

polarization.name: Polarization and Digital Cocoon Formation
polarization.description: Echo chamber effect perspective: 20 agents (8 radical + 8 conservative + 4 neutral) undergo opinion polarization and group division driven by recommendation algorithms. Track emotional contagion mechanisms.

resourceScarcity.name: Social Contract Under Resource Scarcity
resourceScarcity.description: Hobbesian jungle perspective: In a post-disaster community, can agents with social capital survive crises through credit contracts, or will they descend into mass fraud and collapse?

resource_scarcity.name: Social Contract Under Resource Scarcity
resource_scarcity.description: Hobbesian jungle perspective: In a post-disaster community, can agents with social capital survive crises through credit contracts, or will they descend into mass fraud and collapse?
